name: Sofitel Chicago Water Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited Chicago on the strength of recommendations from friends etc. We stayed here for 11 nights and it is a simply fabulous hotel. Very clean hotel, with friendly, unobtrusive staff. We had a great room with a great view of the Hancock building. Somehow we never got around to using Cafe Des Architectes even though it looked fantastic - there was so many great eating places nearby. Bar was great, and very popular too. It's easy to see why this hotel is number one. It's location for the beach, Michigan Avenue, the Pier was fantastic. We are definitely going back...!
reviews.title: Simply superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice room - service was excellent - the staff are obviously well trained. The Consierge service was very helpful. The location is excellent if you want to be downtown near the city's major attractions. Only one block from the Mag Mile, Hancock Centre, Water Tower, etc. and only a short walk from a subway stop.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good room - 25th floor with a view of the Hancock Centre.
reviews.title: Great place, great location!

reviews.text: Lovely decor throughout - fresh flowers in the lobby, clean and attractive.
reviews.title: A beautiful place

reviews.text: No pool, however the workout facility looked nice.
reviews.title: Incredible Hotel

reviews.text: This is a welcoming hotel in a good location for visitors, just one block from the Hancock Tower and Michigan Avenue. I booked a Superior King room with breakfast & wi-fi included in the price – 3 nights. The room was not huge but had everything you needed including a beautifully clean bathroom and a view of the Hancock Tower and the lake from the 28th floor.
reviews.title: Warm, welcoming and very convenient for shopping or business…

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bed was the usual very high Sofitel standard – incredibly comfortable with lovely linens. Towels and bathroom amenities were all good quality (Les notes de Lanvin – not highly scented) and the rainfall shower was fabulous – great water pressure. There was also the standard (deep) soaking tub for those that prefer to prune and wrinkle…
reviews.title: A Few Glitches, But Nice Overall

reviews.text: The hotel employees, without exception – from welcome to goodbye – are great and a major reason for the 5 star rating above. Friendly front desk people who were knowledgeable about both the hotel and the immediate area, breakfast staff who welcomed me each morning with what seemed like genuine pleasure and housekeeping who were just delightful – always with a ready smile (they did a good job too – the room was spotless) Kudos to the management for either their training or their recruitment practices – they definitely chose the right people for this hotel.
reviews.title: Above & beyond service!

reviews.text: Food – I only had breakfast at the hotel but each day was a treat. I found the food to be really delicious – eggs benedict, omelettes made to order, fresh pastry and good coffee (which you could also get “to go” each morning). My room rate included breakfast but had it not I would have happily paid the standard (i.e. expensive) price for the dishes I ate.
reviews.title: No one does style like Sofitel.. and it's definitely on display here.
Location is perfect!
reviews.text: I stayed here a few times, last time for 4 days in November 2012. The hotel is located close to shopping area and restaurant/hip area, if the weather is nice you won't even need to get a taxi to go anywhere as everything will be very close and in summer Oak street beach is walking distance. The lobby of this Sofitel is a amazing and quite a landmark and the bar downstairs is always full with a nice crowd.

reviews.title: great place: well run, efficient
reviews.text: Rooms are good, get a high floor. Breakfast is great at the Cafe des Architect, now they also have a quick to-go breakfast free of charge if you are in a hurry. Two negative point: no pool, an hotel of this level could use a pool (indoor or outdoor). Staff is OK, they forgot to plug in my Accor number and i never got the points for it even after 2 email and 2 phone calls, i think is inexcusable for an hotel such as Sofitel.

reviews.title: Great location Excellent hotel
reviews.text: rooms clean, modern and the bathroom was wonderful. the toiletries included things like fingernail files (good ones.) when I asked the concierge where I might buy contact solution, he pulled some out of the closet behind the front desk.

reviews.title: Four Day Stay - Miracle Mile Christmas Shopping
reviews.text: room service was fast and the food was great. the 'light' menu is amazingly flavorful and filling with calories listed on the menu.

reviews.title: Great hotel and good location for shopping but not so go for business.
reviews.text: my friend was asked to wait 15 min bec. his room wasn't ready. they upgraded him to a suite as an apology.

reviews.title: wonderful hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for a three day holiday in Chicago over the Labour Day long weekend. The hotel was near perfect. We had booked a deluxe room and were upgraded to a deluxe corner suite. Very nice touch. The room was unbelievable, with stunning views of the Hancock Tower and Lake Michigan. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, especially the concierge. The location was perfect; walking distance to the Magnificent Mile, the beach, Rush street at night and a Red Line subway station. The atmosphere was perfect; vibrant and busy, but not like a larger convention type hotel. We have travelled the world and stayed in many places and wouldn't hesitate to highly recomment this hotel for anyone taking a visit to Chicago.

Our two night stay Aug. 28 & 29 was wonderful. Our room was spotless, well laid out, and beautifully furnished. The small shelf in our shower broke away and fell to the floor and broke. Although we didn't make any fuss, the front desk sent us a cheese and fruit tray which I would order again. Morning coffee (a peeve of mine) was quickly delivered both days with a paper, at a reasonable price. Valet parkers were friendly and efficient. Our server in the bar was attentive without hovering, (come to the bar, even if you stay somewhere else) and the drinks were right on. At 5 on Friday, the concierge got us reservations for 7:30 (Ditka's would be 9:30, Fogo 10:30) at a chop house a 20 minute walk (4 min, $7 cab) away. It was excellent. The Sofitel is our first choice in Chicago.
reviews.title: Would recommend to anyone
A poster child of good service/bad hotel
reviews.text: A lovely hotel in a trendy part of Chicago which gives it a much more comfortable feel than the downtown hotels. The rooms are very, very well appointed, but not large, and the quality of the materials is wonderful without exception. Unfortunately, the service was below average in every way: they failed to deliver laundry by an important and assured deadline; valets didn't deliver the car and had to be asked twice; the concierge gave us miserable directions that got us lost, and the front desk was unable to rectify any issue. It amazed me that so much incompetence could happen in 6 hours! And even after recognizing their shortcomings, not one sincere or significant apology.

reviews.title: Possibly the best Hotel I've ever enjoyed!
reviews.text: A poster child of how bad service cannot overcome a well-built, well-furnished hotel.

Wow. Fantastic hotel, excellent facilities. Stayed back in April en route to a wedding in Cleveland. Room was huge, we did book a suite which is actually about the size of 3 rooms. Very comfortable, bed to die for. HUGE bathroom and i mean huge. ate in the restaurant once and it was lovely. Breakfast has a lovely menu with lots to choose from.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous hotel and definately worht all the good reviews
reviews.title: Relaxing weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With so much already said about this hotel, I don't think there's much I can add. But I can confirm all the great things said about the hotel. It's clean, modern, friendly, very service oriented, welcoming, well located, and a great value. The rooms were nice and the beds and bathrooms even better.
reviews.title: LOVED the Sofitel- My FAV hotel
Security issue - I don't recommend this hotel
reviews.text: One thing I could add is the extremely nice location of the hotel, which is central to everything. You have a five minute walk to Michigan Ave., and five minutes up and down Wabash get you to Rush St shopping/eating or Grand Ave. shopping/eating. We walked to Millenium Park and it took about 20 minutes, not too bad. You are surrounded by great restaurants and nice cafes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Like their other properties, this is a GREAT hotel!
reviews.title: One of the nicer hotels we have stayed at in Chicago

likes.liked: — Great bed and bathroom, good food, fantastic location

reviews.text: Had a company meeting and Sofitel was the place. What a pleasure to be there! Best location in Chicago, close to Miracle Mile. Hotel EXTREMELY clean in every area. Rooms very comfortable, spacious, CLEAN and with every item you may need. Breakfast and lunch pretty good. I had a delicious dinner that made me feel I was in a high class restaurant instead of a hotel one!. Service is EXCELLENT. You'll be able to communicate in English, French, Spanish, Estonian, Albanian, and almost every language. However, the best of Sofitel are the EMPLOYEES, always willing to assist you,doing the extra mile to make you feel happy. Beautiful people that will make you feel at home! My gratitute to all, especially Jimi that "found" that espresso coffee late at night after my delicious dinner.Way beyond his work!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Chicago

reviews.text: I'll have one week vacation next July and Sofitel Chicago will be my place to stay!
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: Renejazz.
reviews.title: French luxury!

reviews.text: for additional information please feel free to contact me at: renejazz@bellsouth.net
reviews.title: I am still here and had to comment!

reviews.text: I want to thank Rebecca and entire staff for our wonderful stay celebrating my wife's birthday. Your generous hospitality will long be remembered. The room, view, service, complimentary desert, complimentary drinks, room upgrade, breakfast and facilities made our weekend in Chicago. Thank you! We hope to return soon.
reviews.title: Nice modern Hotel

reviews.text: I live in Milwaukee but travel to Chicago several times a year. Last weekend, I took my wife there for her birthday and we stayed at the Sofitel. I chose to book a room there after reading all the great reviews. After staying for two nights, I can honestly say the Sofitel is a bit overrated. First of all, we spent $260 a night for a cityview room with a king-size bed. We were on the 20th floor, but the room was very small! It was decorated nicely, but my wife and I were pretty unhappy with the size of the room. It was honestly one of the smallest, if not the smallest hotel rooms I have ever stayed in. We didn't let that ruin our first evening, however.
reviews.title: There are better options....
class hotel
reviews.text: The next morning (my wife's birthday), we woke up and when trying to brush our teeth, realized that there was no COLD water. For some reason, there was only steaming, scalding water - too hot to even shower in. We called down to the front desk and they sent up a maintenance person. After about 20 minutes, we called back down and asked to change rooms because we wanted to get ready to leave out for the day. The person at the front desk told us to wait a few minutes and they'd call back. After 20 more minutes, the maintenace guy finally fixed the problem and as he was leaving, the front desk called up to tell us we could switch rooms. I informed them that it was too late, but we'd appreciate some type of credit to our account due to the inconvenience. The woman said all she could give us was about $20 off (not much considering we paid $250 a night). The rest of our experience was okay. Oh, except our bed didn't have a sheet on it! We had to call house cleaning to bring one up!

reviews.title: Nice hotel
reviews.text: Here are some other observations-

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel!
reviews.text: The GOOD: Very quiet hallways (not a lot of kids running around), good room-service, nice views, large bathrooms

reviews.title: Brilliant!
reviews.text: The BAD: No connected parking, SMALL ROOMS, not-so-great staff, loud heating/cooling system, over-rated restaurant and over-crowded bar.

A nice hotel, nice room. We stayed at the hotel for one night for a wedding, only to experience every traveler's worst nightmare. Our room was broken into and robbed while we were sleeping. Cash, jewelry... to make matters worse, the hotel has refused to accept this incident occurred, in so many words accusing us of lying. Can you imagine anything worse? You wake up in the morning to find a purse by the door, cash emptied from your wallets, an expensive bracelet missing (a bracelet worn to the event that night -- so it clearly happened in the middle of the night). The lock interrogation report shows an entry into the room at 2am after we were sleeping. Yet the hotel has been unwilling to rectify this matter. We are lucky we weren't hurt. For the safety of those considering staying at this hotel, I highly recommend against it.
reviews.title: Robbed In Our Sleep In Our Hotel Room

reviews.text: Stayed here on very short notice. Plane delayed because of severe weather and all hotels around airport were sold out. Called the Sofitel, got the room. Sofitel made the best of a lousy situation. Staff friendly and accommodating. Rooms spotless and tastefully decorated. Lounge and restaurant very good. Would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: typical Sofitel

reviews.text: This hotel could not be a better base from which to see Chicago. Perfectly positioned for shopping and some great restaurants.
reviews.title: Superb choice
Fabulous Service and Decor!
reviews.text: Hotel is classy and modern. Staff were great throughout. We checked in as soon as we arrived (11.00am.) Rooms were lovely - bathrooms great (all marble and walk in showers).
Bar area is also lovely - nice touches like a fake but inviting log fire. I would not chose to stay anywhere else. Loved it.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but several problems during stay

reviews.text: Stayed here for a long winter weekend with family. Cozy, comfortable beds.. Large lush towels. Check in was the model of attentive, informative, excellent service. Get up early to enjoy the free croissants. They run out early, so if you're fortunate to hit it right, you'll be the favorite of your family. Large cups of free coffee and tea downstairs. The rooms are perfect sized for the three of us with beautiful views. Even though we were right next to the elevator, the rooms were so quiet The hotel is situated next to several low cost and even all night restaurants which was helpful after late theater. So close to Michigan avenue, we we able to walk to the action of water tower place and lots of shopping. Some reviews implied that there was a pool. There is not, but we were too busy anyway!
reviews.title: Luxurious stay in Chicago

reviews.text: I stayed at the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower for a few nights in Jan '13 and it really couldn't have been better. For the location and quality of the hotel the nightly rate was fantastic value and I will definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Spectacular end to my trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was on one of the higher floors and was really lovely. It was spacious and clean, with a huge bed, armchair and small table and desk. The bathroom was a nice surprise - one of the largest hotel bathrooms I've seen, it had a separate toilet, bath, huge walk-in shower and plenty of bench space with the usual provisions (hairdryer, shampoo, conditioner... even a loofah).
reviews.title: Couldn't have been better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were lovely and helpful, even after my visit. I had a minor complaint about the quality of the internet connection during my stay, which I communicated through the post-stay survey. To my surprise this was followed up almost immediately by the Front Office Supervisor and should be an example for other hotels.
reviews.title: Top notch hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had breakfast in the hotel restaurant one day and although it was nice it was too expensive. This certainly isn't unique to the Sofitel, though, and I should have known better!
reviews.title: Hip Hotel - Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been doing winter getaways at the Sofitel Water Tower for three years. We recommend the Prestige Suite. Beautiful marble bath with a bedroom and a large living room. Wow! This chain is French and modern in decor. You are walking distance from Michigan Avenue.
reviews.title: Lovely and Luxurious

reviews.text: In order to pamper myself after attending a trade show at Chicago's McCormick Place I took two days off and stayed in the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower. This is basically the best hotel room I have ever stayed in, maybe except for Sofitel in Nanjing, China.
reviews.title: Soft pillows and superb service in Chicago

reviews.text: If you are on a budget Sofitel is not an option, but I pre booked and paid in advance which made it a bit more affordable. So in terms of comfort vs price it was a good deal.
reviews.title: Sofi I think I love you!

reviews.text: The hotel is all about service all the way from the curb up to your room. Anyone from the doorman to the cleaning lady are extremely polite. The hotel also has an extremely knowledgeable concierge service.
reviews.title: Awesome hotel with great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back today from a 3 night stay at the Sofitel. This is an excellent choice in the centre of town. Great location for all the shopping on Michigan Avenue and an easy cab ride to all the other sights.
reviews.title: excellent choice

likes.disliked: — air con in room and bar was a bit fierce

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a room on the 10th floor which didnt have stunning views but was more than adequate for our needs. Large comfy bed, large well equipped bathroom and all other mod cons with the exception of no iPod dock which is not a problem but worth knowing.
reviews.title: One of the best stays at a domestic hotel, ever!

likes.liked: — Immaculate comfort with style in a very hip setting. Perfect place to relax and be private.
likes.disliked: — That there isn't one here in the Washington DC area!

reviews.title: Cafe Des Architects is a great place for lunch!
reviews.text: Hotel was buzzy with good restaurant and great bar which is a destination in its own right.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would not hesitate to recommend this Sofitel for anyone looking to stay in Chicago and not necessarily wanting to go for the full on 5 star choice. That said, the service and facilities in the Sofitel are no less 5 star than any of the other top properties we have stayed in. Can't see why anyone would be disappointed with this choice.
reviews.title: AMAZING service, location, amenities

likes.liked: — Room design, location in downtown, restaurant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only thing I wish I had known was how booked up the top choice restaurants get, particularly on the weekend. If you want to go to the likes of Gibsons, Joe's, Hugo's Frog Bar or Carmine's you should not leave it till you get to Chicago to make the booking if you want to eat at a sensible hour.
reviews.title: Always Fantastic at the Sofitel!

likes.liked: — The attention to details and the clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at this hotel before so when we received an opportunity to take advantage of a special deal through the hotel, we jumped right on it. It is in a great location, has a good bar, great lobby, and the rooms are good size. Bathroom is very large - comfortable beds. Made for a great get-away.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sofitel is a very nice hotel in a good location for shopping along Michigan Avenue. Staff could not be better. We stayed in a suite, which had a living room, hallway with bathroom, and a bedroom (long and narrow versus feeling expansive, but worked fine). The bathroom has a separate shower and tub. Doors to shower and toilet were clear, meaning that unless you don't care at all about your privacy, only one person can use the bathroom at a time despite the fact that it is quite large. My other minor complaint is that it has a mini-bar but no fridge. Would have been nice not to have to remove extremely overpriced cans of beer in order to keep anything of ours cold. Very convenient to food: Tempo Cafe just down the street - fabulous for breakfast and easy for takeout instead of waiting for a table. A nice takeout place; a small grocery and a Walgreens also very near.
reviews.title: Good Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have stayed at hotel multiple times. My wife and I love the location, both for shopping as well as access to restaurants. The hotel also has a good bar in which we had a few couples of our meet us at.
reviews.title: Great location, nice rooms, poor TV connectivity

reviews.text: Although we typically are out of the hotel, when we sit down to relax and watch a little TV, we like the TV to actually work. The signal quality was very pool, and often viewed pixelated images making watching almost impossible. Mentioned to hotel in call as well as when checking out. No accommodation given for inconvenience.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, but...

reviews.text: Our stay was wonderful. The hotel is beautiful and is spotless. We appreciated our maid service and attention to detail. Our only complaint is the lounge. We stopped in on Sat. afternoon and again Sat. night for a night cap. Each time the service was spotty at best. Our evening time was horrible. We waited for over 30 minutes for service. My husband ordered ice cream and it was not delivered until the rest of us had our drinks that we waited forever for. He refused it and the waiter was not happy. The place was not all that crowded and there was no excuse for the poor service. The wait staff seemed confused and inefficient.
reviews.title: Beautiful and convenient

reviews.text: everything was perfect at this sleek modern hotel. the staff could not have been more helpful, the bed was ultra comfortable, the location was ideal, and the restaurant was a standout. the room, itself, was great with a tremendous bathroom. a nice hotel makes a vacation so much more fun, and this was ultra nice.
reviews.title: all time favorite hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Amazing Sofitel Water Tower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was very close to perfection.
reviews.title: Loved the decor
Fantastic hotel - highly recommended.
reviews.text: Staff best in the world.
Beautifull suite(upgrading,thanks again)
reviews.title: Awesome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a four day trip to Chicago and the Sofitel was wonderful. We had a suite in the 23rd floor and it was everything that I had imagined. We have stayed at the Waldorf-Astoria in New York and other upscale hotels. This was by far the best. It was super modern. We had flat screen televisions in each room. The King bed was the most comfortable hotel bed that we have ever slept in. When the Bose alarm clock went off, I didn't want to get up. They sent us two Voss waters and some truffles the first night. Everything was well done.
reviews.title: The Sofitel was great

reviews.text: The hotel is two blocks from the Magnificent Mile and everything that we wanted to see was a short walk or cab ride from the Sofitel. We will definitely be back.
reviews.title: Very good hotel, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good hotel, excellent location, very attentive staff. Everything up to scratch!
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But: the rooms are quite small, although the big windows help not making them claustrophobic. Also I found the lobby quite dark even during the day. True enough, it was very atmospheric, but it made it difficult to see properly!
reviews.title: Like everyone says...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wife and I took a quick weekend to Chicago last minute. Booked hotel thru one of the last minute travel sites at around $200 per night. The hotel is very chic and trendy. Room was extremely comfortable and clean. We had drinks in the hotels bar when we arrived. A little pricey but very enjoyable. The hotel is one block off Michigan Ave near the John Hancock building. We had breakfast right next door at Tempo and had a great breakfast before heading out for the day. Be prepared that Tempo only takes cash so plan ahead for that.
reviews.title: Simply excellent!

likes.liked: — The perfection of the room itself.
likes.disliked: — OK, I admit I hate those

reviews.text: What a great hotel! First, the restaurant is absolutely first rate. As a rule, I avoid hotel restaurants since many have a captive audience and don't really try. But, I was tired and it was late and so I had dinner in the hotel restaurant and I was knocked off my feet by its quality. The breakfast the next morning was just as good. The staff was very attentive and the room modern. I came back to my office and told the guy who makes our hotel arrangements just how good this hotel is and--lucky me--I am taking my group there for a meeting in November. I know they will be impressed.
reviews.title: Incredibly Good

reviews.text: We were in Chicago for fun and stayed at this hotel based on a friends recommendation. The staff from the front desk to the restaurant and bar were very attentive and friendly. We were upgraded to a junior suite with great views of the city. The hotel is just 2 blocks from the miracle mile and right off Rush with some other high end shopping.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel close to Miracle Mile.

reviews.text: I booked this hotel on a travel website and got a really good price- when I arrived I expected just an enrage hotel but got way more! The rooms are really nice and the staff is great. A nice feature is that there is a separate shower and bath.
reviews.title: Absolute Luxury.

reviews.text: Can't add much to the rave reviews; only can confirm to the fullest extent as to every positive previous review in all aspects with no negatives whatsoever! Do yourself a favor and spring for the suite. Can't vouch for the restaurant as there are so many great places within easy walking distance: Hugo's/Gibson's, Rosebud, Ditka's, etc., etc. but the bar was quite enjoyable for cocktails and people watching.
reviews.title: All's Perfect @ Sofitel

reviews.text: Stayed here as a treat to myself while in Chicago recently for a concert. I totally LOVED IT here!!
reviews.title: Loved it!!

likes.liked: — Everything - see how the other half live!!
likes.disliked: — Having to leave!! Didnt want too!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you called either the Front Desk or Room Service, the phone was answered with "Hallo Mrs (Name)" which was a great personal touch. Vanessa at the front desk, went out her way to help me - storing some things in a safe for me before I could book into my room.
reviews.title: First Class Hotel!
More of the Best
reviews.text: My room was wonderful - the bathroom was luxurious. I was on the 30th floor and the views were superb. We ordered room service and it came quickly and the guy was so friendly and nice. The doormen were great too and I wore jeans and a tshirt one day and they still opened the door for me, so no snobbery there.

Comfortable, cozy bathrobes were available in the bathroom, the lights went on in the wardrobe (never seen that before!!), tv was HD ready and flat screen. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud - best sleep for a while.
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the greatest hotels that I have ever stayed in! I was over from the UK on business and I picked my girlfriend up from Chicago airport and decided to make use of the valet service. They were brilliant. Car was taken off me and the bags were in the room before I knew it. We had a meal in the restaurant which was very very good and not too formal. There were lovers, families and business people all in the same surroundings without anyone looking out of place. The bar was great and stayed open until 2am at the weekend which was great fun! The room was a little small but nevertheless the views from the 23rd floor were amazing! Our wardrobe door was broken which was a pain but we were having so much fun I could not be bothered to report it until we left!! Superb location. Stayed for two nights.
reviews.title: Fantastic French hotel with stunning views.

reviews.text: Believe all the reviews this hotel is awesome! 10/10
reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic
Fantastic!!!
reviews.text: We loved loved loved the Sofitel and Chicago. We had a five night stay to celebrate two 30th birthdays, both our rooms were fab with gorgeous views of the John Hancock building. We had strawberries dipped in chocolate on arrival waiting in our room. The cleaning staff were unreal, we never saw them but any time we left our room we came back to a cleaned room with fresh towels, also a small bottle of evian each every night. The reception, door and bar staff were extremely friendly - as was almost everyone we met in this wonderful city. The hotel is in the best location, everything was in walking distance, great restaurants, bars and shopping. As a frequent traveller to New York, I have to say that Chicago blew it out of the water for our group and we will certainly be back... and will definately stay at the Sofitel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 days in Dec 07.
reviews.title: Modern and Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ours was a standard room on the 17th floor. Room was a good size with an amazing bathroom. The windows were floor to ceiling, which made the room feel light and open, and we had a nice view. The bed was very comfortable!
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Really loved this hotel. November in Chicago was cold as expected which made it all the nicer to return after a day of sightseeing to a quality hotel. It felt cosy - really nice bed and bathroom and we felt at home in our 4night stay. The staff were friendly. Good central location for walking and metro stop near too. We had a great view from our room and the great design of the building meant it was easily recognisable amongst the skyscrapers on our return home at the end of the day. Had to shop around for a good price but it was worth it!
reviews.title: Luxury respite from the cold

reviews.text: We had a weeks stay at the Sofitel in November. We found the hotel to be wonderful, the decor and overall look of the hotel is very nice. One thing I particullary liked was that every evening in the lobby they lit scented candles, which smelt gorgeous and gave it a really nice feel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.title: Excellent hotel!!

reviews.text: The Sofitel is definitely a great place to stay in Chicago. The location near North Michigan Ave is very convenient. The building is visually stunning and the rooms were clean, spacious, and comfortable. My fiance and I stayed on the 32nd floor and had a nice view of the city. Trying to grab a light bite or a drink at the restaurant or bar was a bit difficult, though. The bar seats were all occupied, but the restaurant was empty save for 2 tables. But they would not seat us for drinks and appetizers, which was very annoying, so we left for dinner early. Late night room service on the other hand was excellent. Also, the valet took forever and stopped our car almost a full block down the street, even though there was space in front of the hotel. Overall, I would highly recommend the hotel - great facility at a great price...just the service needs a little more work.
reviews.title: great facility and location, but service...

reviews.text: This hotel is totally overrated. Yes, the location is awesome, but there are plenty of other nearby hotel options. The customer service, or lack thereof, was particularly disappointing. Why are they paying anywhere from 2 - 8 doormen yet none of them can ever actually open the door for a lady? Even when her hands are full. The housekeeping staff couldn't figure out our preferences even after we left them a daily note explicitly stating such along with a tip -every day. Why ask what newspaper we want with our morning room service when you don't bring it anyway. As stated previously, the location is great. Location, however, does not make up for the complete lack of customer service and inattentiveness from staff. I would not stay here again.
reviews.title: Totally Overrated

reviews.text: Just returned from a glorious Easter weekend in Chicago and 3 wonderful nights at the Sofitel. We were impressed from the moment we walked into the beautifully decorated lobby to the moment we checked-out and that is no small feat. Having travelled extensively for both business and pleasure, we're not easily impressed but the Sofitel succeeded in exceeding our expecations.
reviews.title: A quality hotel in a quality city

reviews.text: The room was bright with a nice view of the city, spotlessly clean and well appointed with contemporary furnishings and a very comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was modern, spacious, well lit and again exceptionally clean. The turn down service with Evian bottled water and the weather forecast for the next day was also a nice touch. The staff were all extremely friendly and attentive.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: We did not eat at the hotel restaurant but the menu and decor looked impressive. The lounge bar had a great vibe and was perfect for having a night cap.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sofitel for a week in October '07. Its location is great (not noisy, short walk to Michigan Avenue & subway station). The staff were polite and the concierge service was excellent. Our room was a double with very comfortable beds. Not large but not small either (Nice Comforters, Huge Window, Very Nice Bath, Well Decorated). The hotel's bar was small but well appointed (I'm from Cal and not used to smoking allowed in bars). The lobby is huge and very chic. We didn't try the hotel restaurant but plenty of places around town and the cafe (can't remember the name) on the same block on the corner was nice and homey. Overall, the Sofitel was a great pick and we had no complaints. I'd recommend it to a friend without reservations.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Nice Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed a long weekend at the Sofitel Water Tower with my partner. The staff was really great and overall we enjoyed our stay. I would stay there again. However, some of the small details that set hotels apart were not always taken care of. I'm Sofitel Privilege member and typically get some in room perks (wine, etc.) upon arrival. This did not happen here. Not a big deal though. The one issue was the lack of hot water in the shower. We mentioned this, but it appeared there was nothing the hotel could do. If you sleep in, your out of luck. We got a great rate on this hotel and its really in a prime location. Nice rooms, nice views too on the upper floors. Great breakfast in the hotel cafe. I highly recommend it. Be aware the north-bound red line subway is not operating right now due to construction.
reviews.title: Nice Stay

likes.disliked: — Lack of hot water at times.

reviews.text: I stayed at the sofitel for business and upon arriving tired and late my reservation could not be found. I had booked my stay with a hotel reservation site instead of the hotel itself and even though nothing could be found, I was able to get a room at the rate I said I was being given. The hotel manager followed up with me about the problem after I was back home just to make sure everything felt good. So much for either of the "W" hotels or other places I normally stay while in Chicago...Sofitel, with it's great location, dynamite beds and luxury bathrooms is my new home in the windy city.
reviews.title: Took care of problem. A+ stay

likes.disliked: — lobby bar often has private parties and is loud.

reviews.text: I have stayed in many Accor hotels around the world and this certainly tops them all. My room was outstanding - extremely comfortable and well appointed. The bed was amazing - so comfortable. Great bathroom as well. Staff were always courteous and efficient. Location was perfect. Highly recommended!
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Sofitel Water Tower Chicago. My husband and I wanted to stay somewhere near downtown and walking distance to different sights. The hotel was located just a couple of blocks from the John Hancock building and close to Michigan Avenue and shopping. The hotel and rooms were very clean and never saw any of the cleaning staff in the hallways while we were there. There was always a complimentary bottle of water next to the bed each night. Very nice touch. Also we read a comment about the candles being lit in the lobby everyday and how nice it smelled, well it was the same while we were there too. We would stay here again and recommend it to others.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!
So close to excellent
reviews.text: My stay was three days on a business trip. This is a very pretty hotel and the hotel staff was very polite and accommodating. It was a very short walk to Michigan Ave. shopping and Rush St. fun. The first floor hotel bar was nice but strangely you had to go up floor to find the restroom – a whoopsy by the architect..?!?.

reviews.title: Flawless
reviews.text: Room: Pros: big flat screen TV, very comfy bed – like sleeping on a cloud, nice shower separate from tub, large well lit bathroom counter, and a safe in room. Cons: There was no coffee maker in the room. When I stayed in a Sofitel hotel in Philadelphia, the Koenig coffeemaker was one of my pros. Had almost an identical room here, but the cupboard that held the coffeemaker in Philly was empty in Chicago. And like many hotels, they neglect to have accessible electric plugs near the bedside stand.

reviews.title: Absolutely the best Hotel experienceWe have ever had!!
reviews.text: Don't think twice about this hotel, just book it. The location is wonderful. Close to many wonderful places to eat and shop as well as the Chicago stop on the red line. The front desk staff were all wonderful and pleasant to deal with. We asked for an upgrade to an upper floor room and they gave it to us even though we booked on Hotwire.com. The room was wonderfully comfortable and quiet for sleeping also. All of the amenities were well placed, handy and appreciated. There was even a Bose system playing classical music in our room when we arrived.

reviews.title: Good location but....
reviews.text: We didn't visit the bar as it was very crowded on a Friday night, however, we did get a table in the restaurant for a cocktail. Great service and nice atmosphere. We visited the concierge a couple of times (forgotten toothbrush, accidentally left room key in the gym) and every time we received excellent service. The housekeeping staff was friendly and they did their jobs well. It was rainy during our visit and the hotel even had umbrellas near the front doors for patrons to borrow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sofitel at the end of June and we are very pleased with the hotel. I would recommend getting the Priviledge Card, since they do upgrade your room. I had booked a standard King room on the lower levels of the hotel and they put us on the 21st floor with a great view. All staff members were very courteous and definitely wanted to make your stay as comfortable as possible.

reviews.title: Made our first trip to Chicago very memorable
LOVED Chicago!!
reviews.text: We absolutely LOVED our recent trip to Chicago and highly recommend the Sofitel Chicago Water Tower, what a fabulous experience. We were a tad bit concerned, when we found out the hotel has a complete French theme, it’s actually French owned BUT the staff was nothing short of incredible. The restaurant CAFE DES ARCHITECTES was amazing; we had room service and NEVER expected such an extraordinary experience. Our trip was business/pleasure, one of our main goals was to find a “White Castle” burger stand, we did and it was well worth the trip, thanks to the accurate directions from the hotels consummate concierge. We enjoyed dinner @ The Tavern on Rush, upscale steakhouse, worth the quick jaunt around the corner from our hotel. We enjoyed the deep dish pizza of Piasano’s ALSO around the corner from the hotel, Carmine’s wasn’t the best but the proximity (across the street from Tavern on Rush) made it worthwhile. Chicago struck us as being quite “seasonal” we went the last week of February and 80 percent of the tourist attractions were CLOSED, we could have saved some time and money, if our cab drivers had informed us of this. For any Californians thinking about visiting Chicago, it’s best to stay downtown, it’s the hub of the city BUT don’t expect to find a large supermarket, such as Ralph’s OR Von’s I enquired and could only avail the Potash Brothers Corner Market, once again, around the corner from our hotel, very convenient, with a great deli counter. We definitely recommend visiting Chicago, it seems that it's livelier May through November.

reviews.title: Fantastic!
reviews.text: Brilliant hotel. I could not fault it. Everyone was extremely friendly and the rooms are beautiful. Amazingly comfortable beds, luxurious bathrooms. What more could you want. The location is perfect and I would recommend anyone looking for a good hotel in Chicago to look no further. I'm definitely coming back!
Heaven! Great beds, marvy bedding, beautiful bathroom good tolietries, nice quiet relaxing rooms, awesome location. A get away right in them iddle of it all. Much nicer than the bigger hotels.
reviews.title: Heaven!

reviews.text: What can be said that hasn't been said before? This is Chicago's best hotel for the money, hands down. The fact that this place can often be had at less than $250 a room makes the Sofitel by far my favorite hotel in the city.
reviews.title: Totally Deserved Rating

reviews.text: From the first phonecall to the hotel reservationist to the final goodbye from the bellhops, the staff at this hotel was among the most accommodating and convivial I've ever experienced. Of course internet booking is so convenient, but call the hotel during the day and request a rate. I was delighted to be offered a regular rate lower than those available on discount travel sites - and I didn't have to prepay. The reservationist also explained the different room types in detail, so I wasn't in that confusing situation of having to choose a room based on vague terminology (ie: "deluxe" versus "superior" room).
reviews.title: Deserves High Rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the Amtrak train into Chicago departing from the Milwaukee Airport station. First, I must highly recommend this as a way of getting to Chicago. The train ride was quick and easy. Once you are in Chicago, cab rides are fairly inexpensive within the city and it was great not having to deal with the traffic, getting lost, and finding parking or gas involved with driving into the city yourself. We arrived to the Sofitel Water Tower very early and I was worried that our room would not be ready, but to my suprise, we were able to go straight to our room on the 32nd floor (top floor!) right away at 9 am. We had an amazing view of Downtown Chicago and even Lake Michigan. The bed was extremely comfortable, and with the curtains tightly closed we were able to sleep in late, very comfortably. Steps away was the luxurious bathroom that I am missing already, only 8 hours later! We spent a lot of time just relaxing in the suite and enjoyed the large LCD tv. We had sushi delivered from Kamahachi and it was great. Not as great as our favorite sushi place, but great that it was delivered right to our suite! The Sofitel was a nice walk from Michigan Ave, and with a pleasant suprise in warm weather, in the 30's, we were brave enough to shop a bit. I can also recommend the restaurant Café des Architectes as a great place for breakfast. The french toast and fingerling potatoes were perfect! Room service breakfast the next morning was just as perfect as it was downstairs. I can see why this hotel is rated as #1 and I will probably always stay at this hotel when I return to Chicago. In fact, I will be sure to check for a Sofitel Hotel in any other city that I travel to. Perfect in so many ways!
reviews.title: Perfect in so many ways

reviews.text: I agree with all the other reviews. This hotel was beautiful and service was fantastic in all respects! Prices were high but the value was very good. We stayed there in a beautiful, modern suite on a "romance package" --this included dinner at the excellent Cafe des Architectes. As part of the package, they waived the entire dinner charge for our family of 4, including tip!
reviews.title: Sofitel was lovely!

reviews.text: We would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: New Tradition

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel last year (2006) with my Mom for some holiday shopping. We enjoyed our stay so much and found the location to be perfect that we came back again in 2007. The rooms and service are wonderful. I live in Chicago and have made it a tradition to stay downtown with my Mom for a night and Christmas shop on Michigan Ave. The location is truly perfect for hitting all the stores and the staff was so helpful with our many trips back and forth to the hotel with lots of packages. The Sofitel is going to be the place we stay -- it is going to be apart of our tradition.
reviews.title: Stunning lobby, great rooms, fantastic hotel!

likes.disliked: — Better views would have made this place a dream come true

reviews.text: We spent a few nights at the Sofitel last week and were very impressed by its design, comfort, location, and staff. After having visited, we can fully understand why this is the best rated hotel in Chicago. The wonderful experience starts at the lobby, which manages to pull off a rare blend of sleek design and decadent comfort. If you ask for a room on the high floors, you'll get a good view of Downtown Chicago and may even glimpse Lake Michigan. However, the views are not the high points of the rooms. The bed was quite simply the most comfortable one I remember sleeping on! So much so that we ended up spending much more time in the room than out and about. The bathrooms are great - spacious, luxurious and bright. The Sofitel is located only a few minutes walk from one end of the Magnificent Mile, and is an excellent starting point for a walk around Chicago. Oh, and if you visit in winter and don't want to brave the elements, the room service menu is actually quite decent. We will definitely be coming back to Chicago and will, without a doubt, stay at the Sofitel again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location

description: Sofitel Chicago Water Tower bids you welcome with world-class downtown Chicago hotel accommodations - minutes from the Magnificent Mile, Michigan Avenue, the Museum of Contemporary Art, the Art Institute, and trendy boutiques. Designed by the French architect Jean-Paul Viguier, our downtown Chicago Illinois hotel is a 32-floor prism of glass, boasting 415 rooms, including 33 luxurious suites. Embrace modern design and rich architectural legacy at this luxury hotel in downtown Chicago, Illinois.
